page.title: 17BRECON AND RADNOR ELECTION
page.content: On July 4th 1985 we had a bye-election in our area. This was because of the death of Mr Tom Hoason. There are seven people who want to be our MP. Mr Richard Livesy in standing for Liberal/ SDP Alliance. Mr Chris Butler is standing for the Conservatives, Dr Richard Willy for Labour. Mrs Janet Davies is the candidate for Plaid Cymru, which wants Wales to be a separate country. Lord Edward Sutch is standing for the Monster Raving Loony Party. There are two other candidates. People over eighteen can vote for one person. They go to vote in the Village Hall. All the votes are taken to Brecon to counted. Livsey had 13793 votes, Willey 13194, Butler 10631, Davies 435, Sutch 202, others 197. So our new MP is Liberal, not Conservative as before.
